CatDescriptText: Mrs. Irene Fulton, doctor's receptionist, 341 Collins Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that students are getting adequate vocational counseling in the schools these days? Do you have any suggestions for increasing or improving it?" answer reads: "I think that the children are getting enough counseling if they will pay attention."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Irene Fulton, wearing light colored button down shirt dress with collar, cuffs, and belt, standing in front of light colored stone block wall with granite wainscot, store window on right displaying flowers and figurines
